Desa fotogenik
05 Nov 2019, 08:00 by Oleh Hazira Ahmad Zaidi



PENDUDUK menikmati pemandangan menarik kampung mereka.



KAWASAN sekitar rumah pelangi bersih dijaga penduduk.


DULUNYA ia sebuah penempatan biasa, namun selepas beberapa rumah di Kampung Sungai Budor di sini, mula dicat dengan warna pelangi, ia sekali gus mengubah landskap kampung berkenaan yang kini menjadi tarikan utama pelancongan di negeri ini.
Idea menarik itu dilakukan Pertubuhan Prihatin Wanita Kelantan dengan kerjasama Majlis Perbandaran Kota Bharu-Bandaraya Islam (MPKB-BRI) dan Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM), untuk mengubah kampung itu menjadi tarikan pelancong.
Penduduk, Wan Nazimah Wan Mohamad, 57, berkata, beberapa rumah penduduk di kawasan itu mula mengalami transformasi pada Mac tahun lalu bermula dengan menukar papan dinding yang uzur dan zink sehingga proses mengecat yang siap sepenuhnya pada awal Jun tahun sama.


KEHIDUPAN masyarakat berjalan seperti biasa.

“Sejak itu, pelancong dari dalam dan luar negara tidak putus-putus datang melihat dan mengambil gambar di sekitar penempatan kami dan mereka berkongsi imej pemandangan ‘fotogenik’ ini di media sosial.
“Boleh dikatakan, setiap rumah penduduk di sini sebelum ini hanya dicat biasa, namun kini dihiasi dengan pelbagai warna seperti kuning, ungu, merah dan biru,” katanya ketika ditemui di sini, semalam.
Seorang lagi penduduk, Jamilah Yusoff, 57, berkata, mengikut perancangan awal, sepatutnya 150 rumah penduduk membabitkan tiga kampung dicat dengan warna pelangi, namun disebabkan beberapa kekangan termasuk faktor kewangan, hanya enam yang dapat disiapkan.


RUMAH penduduk kelihatan lebih ceria selepas dicat dengan warna pelangi.

“Bagaimanapun, ia tetap menjadi tarikan utama kepada pelancong yang berkunjung ke negeri ini dan setiap sebulan sekali pasti ada pelancong dari luar negara termasuk Filipina, Jepun, dan China yang datang ke mari.
“Bagi rumah yang tidak sempat di cat, ada antara penduduk yang mengambil inisiatif dengan mengecat sendiri rumah mereka sedikit demi sedikit.
“Penduduk kampung mengadakan gotong-royong bagi memastikan kawasan persekitaran di penempatan kami sentiasa berada dalam keadaan bersih dan terjaga,” katanya.
Sementara itu, menurut sumber MPKB-BRI, memang diakui penempatan penduduk di Kampung Sungai Budor berada dalam agenda untuk dinaik taraf sebagai tarikan pelancongan baharu di negeri ini.
“Bagaimanapun, kami terlebih dahulu akan melihat kesinambungan daripada projek yang dilakukan sebelum termasuk peruntukan diberikan,” katanya.


TEBINGAN konkrit berhampiran rumah pelangi turut dicat.

A photogenic village
05 Nov 2019, 08:00 by By Hazira Ahmad Zaidi



Residents enjoy the beautiful scenery of their village.



The area around the rainbow house is well maintained by the residents.


It used to be a traditional settlement, but after several houses in Kampung Sungai Budor here, began to be painted in rainbow colors, it transformed the village landscape which is now a major tourist attraction in the state.
The idea was created by the Kelantan Women's Concerned Association in collaboration with the Kota Bharu-Islamic City Municipal Council (MPKB-BRI) and the National University of Malaysia (UKM), to transform the village into a tourist attraction.
Resident Wan Nazimah Wan Mohamad, 57, said several houses in the area began to undergo transformation in March last year, with the replacement of hardwood and zinc wallboards until the painting process was completed in early June of the same year.


The life of the community goes on as usual.

“Since then, local and foreign tourists have come to see and take photos around our sites and they have shared images of this 'photogenic' scene on social media.
"It can be said that every resident's house here used to be just painted, but now it is decorated in different colors like yellow, purple, red and blue," he said when met here yesterday.
Another resident, Jamilah Yusoff, 57, said that according to preliminary plans, about 150 villagers including three villages were painted in rainbow colors, but due to some constraints including financial factors, only six could be completed.


HOUSEHOLD residents look happier after being painted in rainbow colors.

“However, it remains a major attraction for tourists visiting the country and every month there are tourists from overseas including the Philippines, Japan, and China who come here.
“For homes that are not in the spotlight, some residents are taking the initiative by painting their homes on a smaller scale.
"The villagers have gotongong-royong to ensure that the surrounding area of our settlement is kept clean and well maintained," he said.
Meanwhile, according to MPKB-BRI sources, it is acknowledged that the residents of Kampung Sungai Budor are on the agenda to be upgraded as a new tourist attraction in the state.
"However, we will first look at the continuation of the project done before including the allocation," he said.


Concrete cuts near the rainbow house were also painted.
